intro: Dortmanna bridgesii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its botanical features make it an attractive and relatively easy-to-care-for ornamental plant.
